chapter.title: &FUDforum; Features
chapter.para: &FUDforum; includes numerous features, this section will briefly overview most of those features to give you an idea about the full capabilities of &FUDforum;.

sect1.title: Spell Checker
sect1.para: &FUDforum; supports a fully functional spell checker, that if enabled would allow forum users to spell check their messages before posting.
The spell checker utilizes PHP's Pspell library and supports multiple languages.

sect1.title: Templating System
sect1.para: &FUDforum; contains a fully customizable templating system, that allows you to completely customize the the look and feel of your forum. For optimal performance the templates are compiled, so you do loose any speed as you do in other forums by having a templating system.
The controls for the templating system can be found inside the admin control panel.

sect1.title: i18n Support
sect1.para: &FUDforum; has full i18n support, that allows an easy translation of the forum into a language of your choice. Currently &FUDforum; is distributed with 7 languages: English, German, Swedish, Polish, Turkish, Spanish and Chinese.

sect1.title: Group Permission System
sect1.para: &FUDforum; supports a highly capable permissions system, which can be used to control what forum users can and cannot do. Using this system you can grant special access rights to certain users, block users from seeing and/or accessing certain forum etc...

This system also includes support for "group managers" have the ability to manage users in the groups they control. This option allows the admin to delegate responsibility to trustworthy forum members.

The Group Management is done via two control panels, the administrative group manager, which allows the admin(s) to add/remove groups as well as assign group managers and specify what permissions the group managers can assign and/or take away. This control panel also allows the admin to make groups inherit permissions from other groups, thus not needing to specify new permission every time for similar groups.

The second control panel, the user group manager, which allows the group manager(s) and the admin(s) to add and remove users from a group as well as change the permissions of the users inside the group can be a accessed via a link available to all Administrators and Group Managers on most forum pages.

sect1.title: Private Messaging
sect1.para: &FUDforum; includes a private messaging system that if enabled via the global control panel allows forum members to send private messages to one another.

The private messaging system supports forwarding, the ability to send a message to multiple users and reply notifications. If allowed by the administrator, the users may also attach one or more files to their private messages. Just like in a mail client the sent messages are stored in a special folder, 'sent', so that the user can easily refer back to them if the need arises. There is also a 'drafts' folder where the user can keep their unfinished messages.
The admin via the private messaging controls can specify what features the users may use inside their private messages, as well as the amount messages the users can keep in their PM folders.

sect1.title: File Attachments
sect1.para: If permitted by the admin users may attach files to their forum & private messages. The amount of files that the user can attach as well as their maximum size can be defined by the admin on a forum by forum basis via the forum control panel. The ability to attach files to private messages can be defined by the admin via the private messaging system controls.

In addition to specifying the size and the quantity limits the administrator may also indicate what file types can be attached to the messages using the file attachment control panel. The attached files will be matched against the &FUDforum; MIME listing so that a proper file icon can be assigned to the file as well as allowing the file download form to send the proper header to the browser allowing it to interpret the file properly.
It is also possible to restrict certain users from being able to attach files or only allow certain users to attach files using the group management system.

sect1.title: Polls
sect1.para: &FUDforum; supports a complete polling system, which allows users, if permitted to add polls to their messages.

Polls are quick multiple choice questioners, which can be used to gather user options on a matter at hand. The forum tracks the votes and ensures that people cannot vote more then once to prevent ballot stuffing.

sect1.title: Forum & Thread Subscriptions
sect1.para: The users on the forum have the ability to subscribe to threads & forums. By subscribing to a thread a user will receive an E-mail or ICQ notification about any new posts made inside that thread. The subscription to a forum on the other hand will notify the user of any new threads created in the forum.

To prevent sending multiple notifications the notification system will only notify the user if they have no unread notifications for that particular forum or thread. This is extremely useful for active forums where many messages can be posted in a short period of time causing a massive amount of notifications to be sent to the user about the same content.

Each forum member has access to their own subscription control panel, which can be used to see what subscriptions they currently have and allow the user to unsubscribe from any of the subscribed to content.

If specified by the admin, the forum can include the full body of the message in the E-mail notification, so that a user can read and reply to the message directly via their mail client. These notifications come specially formated, so that they are properly displayed on all e-mail clients, regardless of whether those mail clients support HTML or not.

sect1.title: Tree View
sect1.para: In addition to the standard way of viewing messages inside the forum, &FUDforum; supports a tree view, which builds a tree of messages akin to the one used by the newsgroups.

example.title: Sample Tree View
example.screen: [*] Main Message [-] Reply To: Main Message [+] Reply To: Main Message [+] Reply To: Reply To: Main Message [-] Reply To: Reply To: Reply To: Main Message [-] Another Reply to Main Message

sect1.title: Full Text Search
sect1.para: &FUDforum; includes a full text search that allows users to search the posted messages by entering on or more keywords. The user has the option of limiting the search to a particular forum or category or they can search the entire forum. In addition the user may specify whether to search the in the entire message or just in the message subject.

sect1.title: I-Spy & Online Status
sect1.para: I-SPY is a neat feature, that if enabled will allow forum users to see what other forum users are doing at this very moment.

The forum also keeps track of the currently online users, and indicator is placed beside each message showing whether the author of the message is currently online or not. This too can be disabled via the global control panel.

sect1.title: FUDcode
sect1.para: FUDcode is a series of text formatting tags that allow users to style the text of their messages & signatures. More information about this features as well as the complete list of supported tags can be found here.

sect1.title: Smilies/Emoticons
sect1.para: Smilies are commonly used codes to represent emotions, such as :) for example is generally used to indicate happiness. &FUDforum; has a list of 30 commonly uses smiley codes that will be replaced with image representing the corresponding emotion the author is trying to convey. The administrator can add/edit/delete the supported smilies via the smilies control panel.

Whether or not text codes are replaced with corresponding images can be defined by the administrator on a forum by forum basis. The group management system can also be used to disallow usage of smilies.

sect1.title: Avatars
sect1.para: If permitted by the administrator users can choose to have an avatar image which they can either upload to the server, specify a url to or choose from the forum's avatar galleries. The avatar images will be displayed beside their name on all of their posts.

sect1.title: Custom Tags
sect1.para: &FUDforum; allows the administrator to assign users an unlimited number custom tags that would appear on their profile as well as beside their posts. This feature can be used to indicate any special functions of the user.
Custom tags can be added or removed via the user control panel.

sect1.title: User Ranks
sect1.para: User Ranks are assigned to users based on the number of posts they have made on the forum. These ranks may contain a text and/or image indicator showing the user's rank.
The administrator can add/edit/delete the available user ranks via the rank manager.

sect1.title: Censor & Replacement System
sect1.para: In &FUDforum; you can specify that certain strings or words would be replaced by the alternatives provided by the administrator. This is most commonly used to filter in appropriate language from being used in the forum.
The administrator can specify the strings that are to be replaced via the replacement control panel, which supports both basic replacement as well as regex pattern matching.

sect1.title: IP Tracking
sect1.para: &FUDforum; tracks the IP address of all the people who have made posts on the forum. The moderators & administrators can see the IP of the author beside each message posted. In addition to showing the IP, the IP itself is a link to a URL that shows the ISP of the person who's IP this is.

sect1.title: Action Log
sect1.para: &FUDforum; logs all the actions taken by privileged users such as moderators. The action log allows the administrator(s) to see when and what actions were performed by the users with special privileges. This form will also show the log of all the failed login attempts in to the administrator account.

sect1.title: Message Mangling
sect1.para: The ability to edit, delete, move and split threads and messages.

sect1.title: User Blocking
sect1.para: The administrator has an extensive set of tools to block people from the forum. This includes and IP filter that allows blockage of users with a certain IP mask from accessing the forum.
Email filter, blocks all users who's e-mail address matches the mask specified by the admin. This also prevents people from registering with an e-mail that matches the specified mask.
Login filter, block all users who's login matches the mask specified by the admin. This also prevents people from registering with a login that matches the specified mask.

sect1.title: Session Support
sect1.para: If for whatever reason cookies are not enabled on the user's computer &FUDforum; will use URL sessions to keep track of the user. Thus allowing the user use the forum even if they do not have a cookie set on their computer.

sect1.title: Installation & Upgrade
sect1.para: &FUDforum; includes an easy to use installation wizard that will have your forum up and running within minutes. The upgrade process is even easier, simply download the upgrade pack from &FUDforum; website and run the script, this script will automatically perform the all necessary upgrades from any previous forum version.

sect1.title: PHP Related Features
sect1.para: &FUDforum; can be successfully installed on systems with safe_mode enabled as well as PHP installations with register_globals & magic_quotes_gpc turned off.

sect1.title: Forum Speed
sect1.para: Although not a feature per say, it should be noted that despite the many features &FUDforum; is still extremely fast, probably faster then all the other forums that offer similar and even lesser feature sets. This is accomplished by a very highly tuned MySQL or PostgreSQL interface as well as a very optimized PHP code.
The forum will in most cases not take more then 0.1 seconds to generate a page.

sect1.title: Security
sect1.para: Security is an often overlooked feature in many web based applications and as the result many of those applications have large security holes that even the most incompetent of hackers can exploit and cause a great deal damage and annoyance.

We've taken the time to ensure that the default installation of the &FUDforum; offers the greatest possible security given the available tools, to ensure that should your web server be reasonably secure it would be very difficult if not impossible for a curious user or even a hacker to access your sensitive data.

To accomplish this task, &FUDforum; by default will store your files with the most minimalistic permissions possible (0600 for files and 0700 for directories), allowing only the user the web server is running on to access your files.
On servers, which appropriately switch users for each virtual host, like Apache 2 this approach is even safer since all your forum's files would be accessible by you and you alone.

You may think that allowing web server access to your files is equivalent to allowing anyone to access your files. That is simply not the case, on a secure server the administrator would have setup an 'open_basedir' PHP limitation that would have restricted php scripts from accessing files in directories not owned by a current virtual host, thus preventing people from using PHP to access files of other users.

On a properly setup server any programs within the CGI wrapper would not be able to access your files as well since they would run as the user who had executed them if a proper suid interface had been setup by the server's administrator.
So, given a well setup server, even on shared hosting solution your forum's data would be quite secure.
